title: Software Engineer (Platform)
description:
**Knidal®** 
 is building an
 **AI\\-native knowledge platform** 
 designed for seamless human experiences and AI\\-Ready content 
 



  





 We are looking for a Platform Engineer to own the core platform that powers our product. You will build and operate the backend systems, data layer, and infrastructure that make the product reliable, secure, and fast. 
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* **Build** 
 core backend services that power Knidal’s platform
* **Own** 
 the data layer, including NoSQL modeling, performance tuning, backups, and reliability
* **Design** 
 and evolve platform architecture for scalability, security, and cost efficiency
* **Build** 
 and run the deployment pipeline with safe rollouts, rollbacks, and observability
* **Partner** 
 with frontend and product to ship features, and own incidents end to end



  





**What We're Looking For** 



* **Experience** 
 building backend services in production
* **Strong Java background** 
 , with ability to work in Kotlin
* Experience with
 **Terraform** 
 and operating NoSQL databases in production
* **Honest learner** 
 with a growth mindset and strong ownership
* **Open minded, collaborative, and dependable** 
 , with clear communication
* **Location:** 
 Bengaluru\\-based candidates strongly preferred
* Uses
 **AI tools** 
 to increase engineering productivity



  





**Work Model** 




 This is a
 **full\\-time** 
 role. We operate on a hybrid model, balancing collaboration and flexibility:
 


* **In\\-Office:** 
 Required in our Bengaluru co\\-working space for team collaboration days
* **Remote:** 
 Work from home on independent work days



  





**Why Join Knidal?** 




 This is an opportunity to join early and own core platform work. You will have autonomy, direct influence on architecture and reliability, and close collaboration across product and frontend.
 



  





**To Apply** 




 Apply through LinkedIn or send your resume and a link to your portfolio to careers@knidal.com. A short note in your email about
 **why this opportunity resonates with you** 
 would be helpful.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Location Name:** 
 Pune Corporate Office \\- Mantri
   

  

**Job Purpose**
 BFL is building a PG system. The Objective of the team is to integrate highly scalable transactional system for BFL customers. The team would closely coordinate and work with multiple Business Lines to provides solutions of open rewarding, discounts and offers.Culture Anchor:Have high ambitions \\- Inspires the team to aim for higher targets and supports in achieving themOwn It \\- Acknowledges uncertainty and makes changes in own decisions/ actions for better outcomes
   

  

**Duties And Responsibilities**
* Experience in Spring Boot, Microservices, Multithreading and REST APIs.
* Make sure code developed is defect free, scalable, and high performance.
* Strong understanding of the development cycle and programming techniques and tools.
* Complete understanding of Online transaction flow and the entities involved in an online transaction.
* Basic understanding of a Rewards / offers / Promocode systems and knowledge of integration with payment services.


**Required Qualifications And Experience**
 Practice Emotional Intelligence \\- Develops the team, supporting them to do moreListens to others, stays calm under pressure, and treats everyone with respect.

title: Application Developer-Microsoft Power Platform
description:
**Introduction**
 A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long\\-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe. You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio
   

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
* As Microsoft Power developer you will design, develop, customize, and support application solutions using Microsoft Power Apps.Responsibilities
* Microsoft Power developer will do designs, develops, customizes, migrates, and supports business process workflow solutions using Microsoft Power Automate or Microsoft Flow.
* These may include implementing standalone Apps or integrating Apps with other products such as SharePoint, MS Teams etc
* If you thrive in a dynamic, collaborative workplace, IBM provides an environment where you will be challenged and inspired every single day. And if you relish the freedom to bring creative, thoughtful solutions to the table, there's no limit to what you can accomplish here


**Preferred Education**
 Master's Degree
   

  

**Required Technical And Professional Expertise**
* 4\\-6 years of experience in Power Apps.
* Experience with Canvas PowerApps, Model\\-driven PowerApps and PowerApps portals leveraging Power Dataverse.
* Able to guide clients on DLP and Governance


**Preferred Technical And Professional Experience**
* Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Excellent communication skills.
* We always believe that it is deeply important to have the right person for the right job and you are a flawless fit to this strategy. We want people with an openness and ability to learn and who are ready to put good ideas into action. So, go ahead, and grab the opportunities \\- we wish you outstanding success in your career and inspire you to bring your best self to work with IBM

title: Senior Test Engineer
description:
**Location Name:** 
 Pune Corporate Office \\- Mantri
   

  

**Job Purpose**
 The company is going through biggest digital transformation in its history, creating a platform that offers omni\\-channel experience to the customer, supported by our large distribution footprint of over 1 million partners. Our ambition is to create a benchmark of consumer\\-tech experience in the country. This Business unit is at the center of the transformation for the company’s web engines. You come in at a time wherein over the next 3 years you will get an opportunity to be in transformation journey
   

  

**Duties And Responsibilities**
* Automate process for identifying of content, Interface, Functional and performance issues on digital assets
* Hand on experience to code on Selenium, Cucumber and other automation aspects
* Ability to understand business requirements, designs including UX and Interface elements, ability to question and recommend solutions in this space
* Ability to create Test scenarios, test cases and automate them including front end elements. Map this back to the business requirements to ensure that 100% coverage of testing is achieved
* Create process automation streams by exploring RPA tools
* Publish weekly/bi\\-weekly defect reports/dashboards with all the stakeholders
* Identify correct testing strategy for automation of certain use cases
* Create a quarterly testing plan based of specific requirement of different digital assets
* Identify performance enhancement opportunities and define automation process around it
* Strong orientation towards automation and ability to explore, identify and set up new automation processes
* Complete understanding of STLC and ability to implement a working model for different websites
* Hands on experience on customer facing website and creating end to end regression and smoke tests
* Generating test reports on regular basis by defining scope of work with partners
* Experience working with tools like Jira and Confluence or Azure boards
* QA Responsibilities and Processes
* Ability to create Test scenarios, test strategy, test plan, test cases and automate them including front end elements. Map this back to the business requirements to ensure that 100% coverage of testing is achieved
* Understanding of security, risk, and compliance management processes in the context of IT solutions delivery
* Must be able to think beyond obvious and find out innovative ways to deliver in tight timelines and chaotic environments
* Must be able to monitor and deliver key KPIs which will define a delivery and an account


**Required Qualifications And Experience**
 PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATION
   

  

* 3 to 5 years’ experience in testing field with major focus on QA of digital assets like website / portals / Hybrid mobile application
* Relevant experience in QA with strong knowledge of testing fundamentals
* Strong understanding of Software testing life cycle and hands on experience in execution
* ISQTB Certified / other relevant certification in QA automation or RPA
* Good exposure in API testing using SOAP UI/Swagger/Postman
* Complete understanding of SDLC and ability to implement a working model for different websites
* Hands on experience on customer facing website and creating end to end regression and smoke tests


 KEY TRAITS
   

  

* Must be able to think beyond obvious and find out innovative ways to deliver in tight timelines and chaotic environments
* Provide required support and inputs to the team members. Ensure that the Company’ standards and procedures are being followed across testing process
* Enthusiastic, highly motivated and very detail\\-oriented individual \\- positive, “can do” attitude
* Ability to create clarity and structure in a complex environment
* Strong leadership, interpersonal, negotiation, project and people management skills are required. Able to work effectively with key vendors, Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required
* Ability to work under pressure in a dynamic and demanding environment is essential
* Excellent communication skills and able to handle chaos and navigate through it

description:

 NR Trident Tech Park

 Work on mobile app projects to deliver new modules as well as support existing ones.

 and coding standards.

 routing

* Passion for mentoring and fostering the growth of junior developers

title: Linux Devices Software Engineer
description:
This role is one of our general tracks. Apply here for all engineering teams at Canonical who work on low\\-level system technology on autonomous devices across all seniority levels.
   

  

 We hire careful and conscientious engineers who appreciate the challenge of memory, performance, battery and connectivity constrained code that has to work every time in an unreliable and unforgiving world, on x86, ARM or RISC\\-V silicon.
   

  

 Canonical Ubuntu is the leading Linux for software engineers, desktops, cloud and IoT. We bring open source to the world as a high\\-performance, safe and secure platform for enterprise computing, software engineering, and connected devices.
   

  

 These smart, connected devices have the potential to transform every industry. Classic Ubuntu – desktop or server – is widely used in embedded systems because of its developer focus and enterprise grade security maintenance. We partner with the world's most prominent silicon companies to optimise Ubuntu on their latest and greatest chips, as well as with major OEMs and ODMs (PC, servers and connected device manufacturers) to ensure that Ubuntu works perfectly on their hardware.
   

  

 But while classic, 'deb' based Ubuntu is ideal for developers, it has too much variability for appliance or connected device environments, where you want to know \\*exactly\\* what the state of millions or billions of devices might be. So Canonical builds Ubuntu Core, a fully containerised version of Ubuntu that is mathematically precise and rigorously secure. We are working on additional solutions for even smaller devices.
   

  

 We have several teams that focus on open source for embedded environments. We hire outstanding Linux software engineers with a passion for open source, innovation, cutting\\-edge hardware and software technologies in general. You will be expected to make significant contributions through high\\-quality design and code, and to develop your technical leadership.
   

  

 These roles include:
   

  

* Ubuntu Core and snapd software development
* Silicon software and optimisation engineers
* Kernel driver and hardware enablement engineers
* Hardware\\-centric Linux QA Engineers
* Hardware Certification Engineers
* Robotics engineers
* Industrial IoT software engineers
* Networking software engineers (switching, routing, access and SmartNICs)


 At Canonical you will have the opportunity to engage with the broader open source community. We're looking for individuals who can help build a thriving community, contribute to a broad range of technologies, and contribute to the deployment of Ubuntu and Ubuntu Core across the widest range of devices.
   

  

 Location: we have remote roles open in every time zone.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

 Based on the first round of interviews we identify specific teams where you might be an excellent fit, and conduct second round interviews with those teams. Our engineers:
   

  

* Work with the latest Linux kernel and open source technologies
* Deliver Ubuntu for the latest IoT and server\\-class hardware platforms
* Integrate and maintain device\\-oriented software stacks
* Write high\\-quality, well\\-designed software
* Collaborate proactively with other globally distributed teams
* Display technical leadership internally and within our external communities
* Help our customers ship their apps and SDKs on Ubuntu
* Build device OS images with Ubuntu Core, Desktop and Server
* Optimise the Ubuntu kernel and libraries for silicon\\-specific capabilities
* Debug issues and produce high\\-quality code to fix them
* Contribute to technical documentation to make it the best of its kind
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
* Participate as technical lead on complex customer engagements involving complete system architectures from cloud to edge
* Work usually from home, with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for company events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Drive and a track record of going above\\-and\\-beyond expectations
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Passion for Linux or embedded systems software (e.g. kernel, graphics, Yocto)
* Fluency in at least one of Golang, C, C\\+\\+, or Rust
* Professional written and spoken English
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self\\-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result\\-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu or other distro packaging
* Understanding of build systems and toolchains, including for cross\\-compilation
* Experience with firmware, uboot, UEFI, ACPI, DSDT, or boot loaders
* Experience with power management on PCI ASPM, SATA ALPM, low power profiles
* Computer architecture knowledge of x86, ARM, RISC\\-V
* Experience in board design, bring up, and validation
* Experience with electrical engineering design tools (e.g. schematic capture, layout)
* Familiarity with Ubuntu development model
* Performance engineering and security experience
* Shell or Python scripting skills


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance\\-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice\\-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence \\- in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote\\-first company since its inception in 2004\\. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Smart Contract Engineer
description:
* :not(:first\\-child)]:border\\-l\\-0 \\[\\&\\>\\*:not(:first\\-child,:last\\-child)]:rounded\\-none! \\[\\&\\>\\*:not(:only\\-child):first\\-child]:rounded\\-r\\-none \\[\\&\\>\\*:not(:only\\-child):last\\-child]:rounded\\-l\\-none float\\-right ml\\-4 xl:max\\-2xl:page\\-api\\-block:mr\\-62 \\-my\\-1\\.5"\\>
* Open positons chevron\\-right
* 1️⃣Engineering \\-\\>


 Smart Contract Engineer
   

  

* \\+\\*]:mt\\-5 whitespace\\-pre\\-wrap"\\>


 The Dabba Network is a
 **De** 
 centralised
 **P** 
 hysical
 **I** 
 nfrastructure
 **N** 
 etwork that is building high speed wireless networks from the ground up in India. We enable humans \\& machines with internet connectivity at a price that they can afford.
   

  

 Internet and WiFi are critical to every human. Dabba is building the software, hardware \\& operating solutions to make internet access ubiquitous \\& affordable. We believe every household should come with internet, networking, and WiFi; just like water, gas, and electricity, the internet is a fundamental utility.
   

  

 Unlike traditional internet solutions, Dabba's approach is vertically\\-integrated across engineering and operations. We design and manufacture our own hardware, develop the entire software stack, and manage our users’ network.
   

  

 We are looking for people who are excited to work on complex problems, enjoy learning and working with others, and above all, are resilient and empathic. Join \\& help us build something amazing together for the next billion users.
   

  

 hashtag
   

  

**About The Role**
 Our customers chose us for a simple, seamless network experience. Our Software Engineering team is critical to meeting this expectation. The team is small but growing, and as an early member you will have a large impact in forming the foundation of the Software Engineering team and role.
   

  

 hashtag
   

  

 As a Smart contract developer, you will have impact by:
   

  

* Helping to build Dabba software from the ground up
* Help build the first set of smart contracts
* Help create a secure contract system
* Defining how explorer data flows through the system


 hashtag
   

  

 You might be a good fit if you
   

  

* Have experience building smart contracts on the Solana chain
* Have deployed tokens to mainnet
* Are comfortable building staking and other defi activities
* Architecting, developing, and testing full\\-stack code end\\-to\\-end
* Experience turning designs into polished products
* An understanding on how important low latency and performance are to user perceptions of application quality
* Have experience and opinions building on various chains
* Have built end\\-to\\-end products, from server code and data modelling at the database layer up to the UI
* Are open to an experimental environment where we move fast and make incremental changes
* Are comfortable taking ownership and driving technical decisions in an organisation
* Have experience managing API integrations and data ingestion
* You shipped an error to production and got so bothered by it, you decided to make it impossible for anyone at your company to commit the same class of error again
* You’ve forked a library to remove features you don’t want and simplify the interface
* Read through third party software to understand what it does and why it’s broken


 hashtag
   

  

 Bonus points for
   

  

* Experience with iot or wireless in general


 hashtag
   

  

 If you are interested in joining us
   

  

 We encourage you to reach out even if your experience doesn't precisely match this job description. We operate with a growth mindset and expect ourselves and our colleagues to have the capacity and desire for ongoing growth.
   

  

* Tell us a little bit about yourself, why you are interested in what we are doing, and any relevant experience you have.
* Attach your resume.
* Please include links to LinkedIn, Github, any code samples, or blog posts.
* email us with above information to career@wifidabba.com

title: Technical Lead
job_function: Information Technology, Quality Assurance, and Consulting
description:
**Location:** 
 Hyderabad, Telangana, India
 



**Work Model:** 
 4 days/week in office (Hyderabad)
 



**Shift:** 
 1:00 PM – 10:00 PM IST (Evening Shift)
 



**Experience:** 
 7–12 Years
 



**Role Overview** 




 We are seeking a highly experienced
 **Senior .NET Core Developer** 
 with strong backend expertise and working knowledge of
 **AWS cloud services** 
 as well as
 **basic frontend skills** 
 (Angular/React/JavaScript). You will design, develop, and maintain enterprise\\-grade applications, collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, and help drive architecture and best practices.
 



**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design, develop, test, and maintain scalable backend services using
 **.NET Core and C\\#** 
 .
* Build and consume
 **RESTful APIs / Web APIs** 
 for integration with front\\-end and third\\-party systems.
* Work with
 **AWS services** 
 (e.g., EC2, Lambda, S3, RDS, API Gateway, DynamoDB, CloudWatch) to architect and deploy cloud\\-native solutions.
* Implement frontend functionality using
 **Angular, React, or modern JavaScript/HTML/CSS** 
 , ensuring seamless UI integration with backend APIs.
* Optimize application performance, reliability, and security.
* Write clean, maintainable, and well\\-documented code; follow best practices and coding standards.
* Perform unit testing, debugging, and troubleshooting across the stack.
* Participate in agile ceremonies (planning, standups, retrospectives) and collaborate with DevOps/QA teams for CI/CD.
* Mentor junior developers and participate in code reviews.



**Required Skills \\& Experience** 




**Technical Skills** 



* 7–12 years of professional experience in software development using
 **.NET Core (C\\#)** 
 .
* Strong understanding of
 **AWS cloud services** 
 and experience deploying applications in AWS.
* Experience with
 **frontend technologies** 
 such as
 **Angular or React** 
 (or equivalent JS frameworks) for building UI components.
* Proven experience designing and implementing
 **RESTful APIs/Microservices** 
 .
* Familiarity with
 **SQL/NoSQL databases** 
 (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, DynamoDB).
* Experience with
 **version control** 
 (Git), CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and agile frameworks.



**Soft Skills** 



* Excellent
 **communication** 
 and
 **collaboration** 
 skills in cross\\-functional teams.
* Strong
 **problem\\-solving** 
 and
 **analytical** 
 skills.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and mentor junior engineers.



**Preferred (Nice\\-to\\-Have)** 



* Experience with
 **microservices architecture** 
 and scalable cloud solutions.
* Knowledge of
 **containerization** 
 (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Exposure to
 **DevOps tools** 
 (Terraform, Jenkins, AWS CloudFormation, CDK).
* Prior experience working in
 **hybrid/remote agile teams** 
 .



**Benefits / Other Details** 



* Competitive salary (based on experience)
* Health \\& insurance benefits
* Professional growth and training opportunities



  





 Regards
 



 Sanjay Bhatt
 



 8447940909
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services

description:

 But while classic, 'deb' based Ubuntu is ideal for developers, it has too much variability for appliance or connected device environments, where you want to know \\*exactly\\* what the state of millions or billions of devices might be. So Canonical builds Ubuntu Core, a fully containerised version of Ubuntu that is mathematically precise and rigorously secure. We are working on additional solutions for even smaller devices.
   

  

 We have several teams that focus on open source for embedded environments. We hire outstanding Linux software engineers with a passion for open source, innovation, cutting\\-edge hardware and software technologies in general. You will be expected to make significant contributions through high\\-quality design and code, and to develop your technical leadership.
   

  

 These roles include:
   

  

* Ubuntu Core and snapd software development
* Silicon software and optimisation engineers
* Kernel driver and hardware enablement engineers
* Hardware\\-centric Linux QA Engineers
* Hardware Certification Engineers
* Robotics engineers
* Industrial IoT software engineers
* Networking software engineers (switching, routing, access and SmartNICs)


 At Canonical you will have the opportunity to engage with the broader open source community. We're looking for individuals who can help build a thriving community, contribute to a broad range of technologies, and contribute to the deployment of Ubuntu and Ubuntu Core across the widest range of devices.
   

  

 Location: we have remote roles open in every time zone.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

 Based on the first round of interviews we identify specific teams where you might be an excellent fit, and conduct second round interviews with those teams. Our engineers:
   

  

* Work with the latest Linux kernel and open source technologies
* Deliver Ubuntu for the latest IoT and server\\-class hardware platforms
* Integrate and maintain device\\-oriented software stacks
* Write high\\-quality, well\\-designed software
* Collaborate proactively with other globally distributed teams
* Display technical leadership internally and within our external communities
* Help our customers ship their apps and SDKs on Ubuntu
* Build device OS images with Ubuntu Core, Desktop and Server
* Optimise the Ubuntu kernel and libraries for silicon\\-specific capabilities
* Debug issues and produce high\\-quality code to fix them
* Contribute to technical documentation to make it the best of its kind
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
* Participate as technical lead on complex customer engagements involving complete system architectures from cloud to edge
* Work usually from home, with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for company events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Drive and a track record of going above\\-and\\-beyond expectations
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Passion for Linux or embedded systems software (e.g. kernel, graphics, Yocto)
* Fluency in at least one of Golang, C, C\\+\\+, or Rust
* Professional written and spoken English
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self\\-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result\\-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu or other distro packaging
* Understanding of build systems and toolchains, including for cross\\-compilation
* Experience with firmware, uboot, UEFI, ACPI, DSDT, or boot loaders
* Experience with power management on PCI ASPM, SATA ALPM, low power profiles
* Computer architecture knowledge of x86, ARM, RISC\\-V
* Experience in board design, bring up, and validation
* Experience with electrical engineering design tools (e.g. schematic capture, layout)
* Familiarity with Ubuntu development model
* Performance engineering and security experience
* Shell or Python scripting skills


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance\\-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice\\-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence \\- in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote\\-first company since its inception in 2004\\. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Location Name:** 
 NR Trident Tech Park
   

  

**Job Purpose**
 We are starting some projects with Service Now and for this purpose we need senior developers.
   

  

**Duties And Responsibilities**
* We are seeking a skilled ServiceNow Application Developer to design, develop, and implement solutions on the ServiceNow platform.
* Must have certification on ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD).
* Must have certification on ServiceNow Certified System Administrator.
* Strong knowledge on Service Portal, Service Catalogue, App Engine Studio \\& UI Builder env.
* Strong understanding of ServiceNow data schema, including table relationships, schema map, and dictionary settings; experience with creating and managing custom tables.
* Basic knowledge of SQL or database querying concepts to understand data flows, reporting, and integrations
* The ideal candidate will have experience in customizing ServiceNow applications, integrating with third\\-party systems, and optimizing workflows.
* Responsibilities include collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements, developing scripts and workflows, and ensuring system performance and security.
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and knowledge of ITIL processes are essential.
* E2E understanding on Service Now deployment.
* Require proven abilities to analyze, debug and find solution to technology issues.
* Should have ability to adopt new development processes and improve existing processes if needed.
* Required good understanding in SDLC process.
* Passion to learn and work on any technology.
* Require good written and spoken communication skills in English. (Knowing Hindi will add advantage).


**Key Decisions / Dimensions**
* Adopt new processes/ improve existing processes to deliver better business solutions.
* Adhere to quality / info\\-security guidelines and processes including maintain adequate documentation.
* Attend review meetings, business user meetings, IT meetings etc.


**Educational Qualifications**
**Required Qualifications and Experience**
* B.E/ B.Tech /MCA


**Work Experience**
* Minimum 2\\.5\\+ years of experience in software development with Service Now.

title: Automation Test Lead
job_function: Quality Assurance, Information Technology, and Consulting
description:
**Job Title: Senior Automation Tester – AWS, Selenium \\& Java** 




**Location:** 
 Gurgaon, Haryana, India
 



**Experience:** 
 7–12 Years
 



**Job Summary** 




 We are seeking an experienced
 **Automation Tester** 
 with strong expertise in
 **Selenium, Java, AWS, and test automation frameworks** 
 . The ideal candidate will design, develop, maintain, and execute automated testing solutions to ensure the quality and performance of complex software applications. You’ll work closely with development, QA, and DevOps teams to enable robust automation across web and cloud\\-based systems.
 



**Key Responsibilities** 




 • Design, develop, and execute automated test scripts using
 **Selenium WebDriver with Java** 
 for functional and regression testing.
 



 • Implement and maintain automation frameworks, BDD approaches (e.g., Cucumber), and modular reusable components.
 



 • Integrate automated tests with
 **CI/CD pipelines** 
 (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
 



 • Collaborate with development, product, and QA teams to understand requirements and translate them into effective test plans.
 



 • Perform
 **API testing** 
 using tools like RestAssured, Postman, or equivalent and validate backend services.
 



 • Analyse test results, track defects, report issues, and work with technical teams for timely resolution.
 



 • Develop and uphold best practices for test automation, including test data management and results reporting.
 



 • Ensure test coverage across web, API, and cloud\\-based applications. (Add AWS testing integration where applicable).
 



  





**Required Skills \\& Qualifications** 




 •
 **7–12 years of experience** 
 in software test automation.
 



 • Strong hands\\-on experience with
 **Selenium WebDriver with Java** 
 development.
 



 • Solid coding skills in
 **Java** 
 and understanding of automation frameworks (TestNG, JUnit).
 



 • Experience working with
 **AWS** 
 services for cloud\\-based automation or testing environments (e.g., EC2, Lambda, S3\\) — preferred.
 *(If AWS certifications/experience needed, mention specifics)* 
 .
 



 • Experience in API automation testing (RestAssured, Postman).
 



 • Integration of automated tests within
 **CI/CD environments** 
 (Jenkins, GitLab CI).
 



 • Knowledge of
 **BDD frameworks** 
 (Cucumber) and good understanding of SDLC \\& STLC.
 



 • Strong analytical, debugging, and problem\\-solving skills.
 



 • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
 



**Education** 




 • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in
 **Computer Science, Engineering, IT** 
 , or related field.
 



**Nice to Have (Optional)** 




 • Experience with
 **Cloud testing tools** 
 or AWS automation frameworks.
 



 • Experience with performance testing (JMeter, LoadRunner).
 



 • Exposure to
 **containerization or orchestration** 
 (Docker, Kubernetes).
 



  





 Regards
 



 Sanjay Bhatt

title: Linux Devices Software Engineer
description:
This role is one of our general tracks. Apply here for all engineering teams at Canonical who work on low\\-level system technology on autonomous devices across all seniority levels.
   

  

 We hire careful and conscientious engineers who appreciate the challenge of memory, performance, battery and connectivity constrained code that has to work every time in an unreliable and unforgiving world, on x86, ARM or RISC\\-V silicon.
   

  

 Canonical Ubuntu is the leading Linux for software engineers, desktops, cloud and IoT. We bring open source to the world as a high\\-performance, safe and secure platform for enterprise computing, software engineering, and connected devices.
   

  

 These smart, connected devices have the potential to transform every industry. Classic Ubuntu – desktop or server – is widely used in embedded systems because of its developer focus and enterprise grade security maintenance. We partner with the world's most prominent silicon companies to optimise Ubuntu on their latest and greatest chips, as well as with major OEMs and ODMs (PC, servers and connected device manufacturers) to ensure that Ubuntu works perfectly on their hardware.
   

  

 But while classic, 'deb' based Ubuntu is ideal for developers, it has too much variability for appliance or connected device environments, where you want to know \\*exactly\\* what the state of millions or billions of devices might be. So Canonical builds Ubuntu Core, a fully containerised version of Ubuntu that is mathematically precise and rigorously secure. We are working on additional solutions for even smaller devices.
   

  

 We have several teams that focus on open source for embedded environments. We hire outstanding Linux software engineers with a passion for open source, innovation, cutting\\-edge hardware and software technologies in general. You will be expected to make significant contributions through high\\-quality design and code, and to develop your technical leadership.

* Ubuntu Core and snapd software development
* Silicon software and optimisation engineers
* Kernel driver and hardware enablement engineers

* Industrial IoT software engineers

* Contribute to technical documentation to make it the best of its kind
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
* Participate as technical lead on complex customer engagements involving complete system architectures from cloud to edge
* Work usually from home, with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for company events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Drive and a track record of going above\\-and\\-beyond expectations
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Passion for Linux or embedded systems software (e.g. kernel, graphics, Yocto)
* Fluency in at least one of Golang, C, C\\+\\+, or Rust
* Professional written and spoken English
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self\\-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result\\-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu or other distro packaging
* Understanding of build systems and toolchains, including for cross\\-compilation
* Experience with firmware, uboot, UEFI, ACPI, DSDT, or boot loaders
* Experience with power management on PCI ASPM, SATA ALPM, low power profiles
* Computer architecture knowledge of x86, ARM, RISC\\-V
* Experience in board design, bring up, and validation
* Experience with electrical engineering design tools (e.g. schematic capture, layout)
* Familiarity with Ubuntu development model
* Performance engineering and security experience
* Shell or Python scripting skills


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance\\-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice\\-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence \\- in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote\\-first company since its inception in 2004\\. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

title: Senior Software Dev Engineer, Core Services
description:
**Description**
 Amazon.com's Risk Management Team has a worldwide reputation as the \\#1 in eCommerce Fraud Prevention. Trust and Safety of our customers comes first. We thrive on maintaining the highest bar of customer experience while we maintain those tenets. Do you want to join a team that works on internet scale systems, uses cloud computing services, leverages State of The Art technologies and Gen AI tools?
   

  

 The Core Services team owns the charter of evaluating bad actor risk of all kinds (Buyer, Seller, Brand, Vendor) across entities such as Orders, Returns, Sign\\-ins, Listings and any event that will be useful to evaluate risky behavior. We build self\\-service capabilities to experiment and launch new use cases while making it easy to on\\-board and manage existing ones all over the world. We are the gate keepers of customer trust by preventing bad actors from doing damage to good customers or scamming Amazon. The problems we solve will challenge the best in terms of scale (100s of billion evaluations) and latency (think milliseconds) while operating at the lowest cost
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As a Senior Software Development Engineer, you will design, enhance and maintain mission critical systems leveraging best of breed technologies with AI first mindset. Successful candidates will be leaders who can identify high impact opportunities and create durable solutions that scale globally. This role requires expertise in technical leadership, strategic thinking, and a passion for mentoring others.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
* 8\\+ years of non\\-internship professional software development experience
* 5\\+ years of programming with at least one software programming language experience
* 5\\+ years of leading design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
* Experience as a mentor, tech lead or leading an engineering team


**Preferred Qualifications**
* 8\\+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
* Knowledge of professional software engineering \\& best practices for full software development life cycle, including coding standards, software architectures, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing, and operational excellence
* Continuous learning mindset and adaptability to new technologies
* Problem\\-solving abilities with attention to detail
* Track record of thinking strategically, taking ownership, and diving deep into technical problems


 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Ecolab is looking for a
 **Sr** 
**Software Engineer** 
 to enhance, maintain and support business application platforms. The Sr Software Engineer will apply engineering and programming best practices to deliver and enhance software solutions that meet business needs. Designs, codes, tests, debugs and documents those solutions. Works directly with peers in digital technology organization as well as with business associates on projects and support. Self\\-motivated professional, able to function independently and within a team structure.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
* The opportunity to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges, helping customers achieve clean water, safe food, and healthy environments
* The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth
* The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives and ideas to achieve our best


**What You Will Do**
* Provide technical design/support/development for various business application platforms supporting Ecolab GBS business areas globally
* Ability to apply strong analytical skills even in areas currently not proficient or vaguely defined
* Provide analysis needed to resolve support issues, optimize system performance and ensure the availability, performance and application security of critical business platforms
* Provide operational support for various business applications
* Provide technical guidance to junior team members
* Collaborate with technology peers and third\\-party vendor support teams on support issues and solutions to meet business needs
* Participate in periodic maintenance activities, refreshes, patching, disaster recovery and upgrades
* Drive solutions to support issues to successful completion within the support SLA
* Responsible for the support and proactive monitoring of the business applications including installation, performance, break fixes and change requests per business requirements
* Create and maintain detailed business application documentation


**Minimum Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline (Computer Science, Engineering or MIS) or equivalent work experience
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in Information Technology
* Minimum 3 years’ experience in software installation, upgrades, performance tuning, support and administration
* Experience with applications running on Windows/UNIX Operating System
* Experience with application and server monitoring tools (SCOM, Elastic, AppDynamics)
* Experience working with third\\-party support teams
* Able to act independently, seeking guidance and advice as appropriate


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with SAP integrated business applications
* Experience with integration via sFTP, API, EDI, RFC
* Experience with SaaS solutions
* Experience developing jobs in scheduling software UC4/Automic Automation or similar scheduling tool
* Experience with ServiceNow
* Knowledge of security, database, hardware, networks and cloud \\& virtualization concepts


 A trusted partner at nearly three million commercial customer locations, Ecolab (ECL) is the global leader in water, hygiene and infection prevention solutions and services. With annual sales of $13 billion and more than 45,000 associates, Ecolab delivers comprehensive solutions, data\\-driven insights and personalized service to advance food safety, maintain clean and safe environments, optimize water and energy use, and improve operational efficiencies and sustainability for customers in the food, healthcare, hospitality and industrial markets in more than 170 countries around the world.
   

  

 When you come to work at Ecolab, you get to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges and have the opportunity to learn and grow, shape your career, make an impact and quickly see the importance of your work.
   

  

 For more Ecolab news and information, visit www.ecolab.com. Follow us on Twitter @ecolab, Facebook at facebook.com/ecolab, LinkedIn at Ecolab or Instagram at Ecolab Inc
   

  

**Our Commitment to a Culture of Inclusion \\& Belonging**
 Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance in all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement. Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.

title: Deputy National Lead - Data Science
description:
**Location Name:** 
 Pune Corporate Office \\- Mantri
   

  

**Job Purpose**
 To lead the Search AI capability by developing state\\-of\\-the\\-art search systems and machine learning models, enabling scalable, accurate, and intelligent search experiences across BFL businesses. The role contributes directly to enhancing customer experience, driving efficiency, and building AI\\-based horizontal capabilities for search, ranking, and personalization.
   

  

**Duties And Responsibilities**
* Lead a team of search engineers to design, build, and optimize horizontal search systems.
* Develop and prototype algorithms to improve indexing, query relevance, and search performance.
* Build and manage taxonomy, thesaurus, ontology, and metadata models to improve search accuracy.
* Partner with business stakeholders across Loans, Insurance, and Investments to deliver AI\\-enabled search solutions.
* Analyze customer behavior and website metrics to refine models and improve search outcomes.
* Drive cross\\-functional initiatives, working with engineers, designers, and product teams to deliver end\\-to\\-end solutions.
* Build production\\-grade ML systems for ranking, personalization, and recommendation engines.
* Collaborate with vendors/partners on capability development and proof\\-of\\-concepts.
* Implement best practices for software engineering including CI/CD, testing, release, and operations.
* Stay updated on academic and industry developments in AI/ML and design competitive services for next\\-gen products.


**Key Decisions / Dimensions**
* Strategic decisions on design, architecture, and optimization of search systems.
* Prioritization of AI/ML projects and resource allocation across initiatives.
* Technology stack, frameworks, and model selection for AI\\-driven search.
* Approaches to improve customer search experience using taxonomy, NLP, and ML models.
* Team management decisions on mentoring, allocation, and performance improvement.


**Major Challenges**
* Balancing multiple stakeholders’ needs while ensuring scalability and robustness of AI solutions.
* Managing competing priorities, tight deadlines, and production\\-grade deployments.
* Staying ahead of emerging technologies in search, ML, NLP, and LLMs while ensuring practical adoption.
* Building state\\-of\\-the\\-art ML/AI models that can serve high\\-volume production traffic reliably.
* Ensuring high system uptime and seamless customer search experience across platforms.


**Educational Qualifications**
**Required Qualifications and Experience**
* PhD/MTech/BE/BTech/MSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Statistics, or related quantitative fields.


**Work Experience**
* 10\\+ years in Search, Information Retrieval, NLP, Machine Learning, and Predictive Analytics solutions.
* Proven record of delivering ML/AI\\-based products at production scale.
* Experience leading teams and mentoring in AI/ML fields.


**Mandatory Skills**
* Expertise in Search platforms: Data connectors, indexing, faceted search, query expansion, NLP\\-driven search, image/voice/visual search.
* Strong coding skills in Python, Java, Scala.
* Experience with Hadoop, Spark, Large Scale ML algorithms.
* Hands\\-on with ML/DL frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, scikit\\-learn, Caffe, Theano.
* RESTful API, web services, integration with SQL/NoSQL databases (Cosmos DB, Cassandra, MongoDB).
* Knowledge of DevOps pipelines (Azure DevOps), CI/CD tools (Eclipse, Git, Jenkins, JFrog).
* Strong understanding of OOP, Linux environments, Agile practices.


**Preferred Skills (Nice To Have)**
* Experience with Elasticsearch/Solr, Lucene\\-based engines.
* Experience with container orchestration (Kubernetes) and distributed systems.
* Knowledge of modern front\\-end technologies (React/Angular, HTML5, CSS3\\).
* Publications/patents in AI/ML/NLP.
* Hands\\-on coding and ability to develop prototypes rapidly.
